North Korea fires cruise missiles off west coast, Seoul saysNorth Korea fired multiple cruise missiles towards the sea off its west coast on Wednesday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 01:30:57 GMT Y4SO37ZIKJNXTA5WXM5IHB5N3I https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/north-korea-fires-cruise-missiles-off-west-coast-seoul-says-2024-01-24/Reuters世界亚太地区
Plan for one-month Gaza truce makes progress as Israel hits Khan YounisIsrael and Hamas have moved closer to agreement on a 30-day ceasefire in Gaza when Israeli hostages and Palestinians prisoners would be released, sources told Reuters, as Israel pressed ahead with its assault on southern Gaza's main city of Khan Younis. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 01:29:38 GMT AWMO5ZFLUFJW3LDB4BAPTZM4YQ https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/plan-one-month-gaza-truce-makes-progress-israel-hits-khan-younis-2024-01-24/Andrew Mills, Arafat Barbakh, Emily Rose世界中东
Philippine says armed forces to ensure 'unimpeded and peaceful' exploration in South China SeaThe Philippines armed forces will guarantee the "unimpeded and peaceful" exploration and exploitation of natural resources within the country's exclusive economic zone (EEZ) as it shifts its focus to external defence, Manila's defense secretary said. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 01:27:14 GMT XGYJZZI7S5IURNZZJGO5XILVAQ https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-says-armed-forces-ensure-unimpeded-peaceful-exploration-south-china-2024-01-24/Reuters世界亚太地区
Plane crashes in Canada's Northwest Territories, some killedA small airliner registered to Northwestern Air Lease crashed near Forth Smith in Canada's remote Northwest Territories on Tuesday, killing some people on board. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 01:18:42 GMT 43VNHJAMTVNRVMWK7F6RSIYVFE https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/plane-crashes-canadas-northwest-territories-some-killed-2024-01-24/Nia Williams世界美洲
Tuvalu expected to review Taiwan ties after election - ministerTuvalu expects to review its diplomatic ties with Taiwan after Friday's election, Finance Minister Seve Paeniu told Reuters, adding voters in the tiny Pacific Island nation wanted more financial support from the international community for climate change and development. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 01:06:46 GMT AEDREMNUPVLSDF6CK5UF4PIW4U https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/tuvalu-expected-review-taiwan-ties-after-election-minister-2024-01-24/Kirsty Needham世界亚太地区
Ukraine's Zelenskiy forms business council after outcry over banker's arrestUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy announced the creation of a council to "support entrepreneurship" on Tuesday aimed at bringing business leaders onside in wartime after many expressed outrage at the arrest of a prominent banker. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 00:43:19 GMT W7B3KDLYSFIWZECASCJ3NQ3HNY https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraines-zelenskiy-forms-business-council-after-outcry-over-bankers-arrest-2024-01-24/Reuters世界欧洲
Australia names media exec Kim Williams chair of national broadcaster ABCThe Australian government on Wednesday named longstanding media executive Kim Williams the next chairperson of the country's national broadcaster, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC). Pilbara Minerals' Q2 revenue halves, focuses on cutting costsAustralia's Pilbara Minerals reported a 46% sequential drop in its second-quarter revenue on Wednesday as average realised price for spodumene halved, and lowered annual capital expenditure guidance. Lula upset by lack of clear goals in Brazil's new industry plan, sources sayBrazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was displeased by a new industrial development plan announced on Monday by the government and told ministers it lacked clear targets, said two people familiar with the matter. Wed, 24 Jan 2024 00:14:50 GMT GYXSNWUGQJO73LGFUI3OOXPCMQ https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/lula-upset-by-lack-clear-goals-brazils-new-industry-plan-sources-say-2024-01-24/Lisandra Paraguassu世界美洲
UK's Cameron to raise concerns over Gaza death toll on Israel visitBritish Foreign Secretary David Cameron will travel to Israel on Wednesday where he is expected to raise concerns over the high number of Palestinians killed and push for a "sustainable" ceasefire in the Gaza war. Thai court to decide former PM hopeful's fate in election caseA Thai court will on Wednesday rule on whether former prime ministerial hopeful Pita Limjaroenrat broke the rules of a 2023 election won by his party, the first of two cases targeting an opposition that has threatened radical reforms to the country.
